Forensic Economics Services in Washington

Our forensic economics practice provides economic damage analysis for litigation matters throughout Washington and District of Columbia. We combine economic methodology with local market knowledge to deliver accurate, damage calculations.

Personal Injury & Wrongful Death

Economic loss calculations for catastrophic injuries and wrongful death cases in Washington:

  • Lost earnings and earning capacity
  • Fringe benefits valuation
  • Household services losses
  • Loss of parental guidance
  • Present value calculations
  • Life expectancy adjustments

Employment Litigation

Economic damages for workplace disputes and discrimination cases:

  • Wrongful termination damages
  • Front pay and back pay calculations
  • Lost benefits and pension values
  • Mitigation analysis
  • Statistical discrimination analysis
  • Wage and hour violations

Commercial Damages

Business economic losses for commercial litigation:

  • Lost profits calculations
  • Business interruption losses
  • Breach of contract damages
  • Unfair competition impacts
  • Intellectual property damages
  • Reasonable royalty rates

Washington Courts Served

  • professional Court of the District of Columbia
  • U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia
  • State appellate courts
  • Alternative dispute resolution

Our Forensic Economics Methodology

1. Case Review

Comprehensive review of case materials, medical records, employment history, and relevant economic data specific to Washington.

2. Economic Analysis

Detailed calculations using District of Columbia wage data, industry statistics, and economic projections relevant to the Washington market.

3. Report Preparation

Clear, expert reports that meet court requirements.

4. Expert Testimony

courtroom testimony that clearly explains complex economic concepts to judges and juries.

Washington Economic Expertise

Our forensic economics practice combines national experience with knowledge of the Washington economy. We understand the local labor market, wage patterns, industry composition, and economic trends that impact damage calculations in District of Columbia litigation.

Local Wage Data

Access to Washington-specific wage surveys and compensation data for accurate earnings projections.

Industry Knowledge

Understanding of major Washington employers and industry sectors for relevant economic analysis.

Court Experience

testimony experience in Washington courts with knowledge of local procedures and preferences.
